砠字的基本解释

砠
jū
上面有土的石山；一说为上面有石的土山。

砠字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jū］
［《廣韻》七余切，平魚，清。］
亦作“岨1”。
(1)戴土的石山。《诗·周南·卷耳》：“陟彼砠矣，我馬瘏矣。”毛传：“石山戴土曰砠。”参阅清马瑞辰《毛诗传笺通释》卷七五。一说为戴石的土山。
(2)见“砠”。
[②]［zū］
秤锤。

砠字的康熙字典解释

【午集下】【石字部】　砠； 康熙笔画：10； 页码：页828第28
【廣韻】【韻會】七餘切【集韻】【正韻】千余切，?音疽。【說文】作岨。【爾雅·釋山】土戴石爲砠。【詩·周南】陟彼砠矣。　【韻會】詩詁云：土山戴石，行者以爲苦，故云馬瘏僕痡。毛傳：石山戴土。誤。

砠字的起名意思

暂无。

rocky hill
Basic explanation of words
rocky hill
jū
A rocky mountain with soil on it; one is said to be an earthy mountain with rocks on it.
rocky hill
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［jū］
["Guangyun" more than seven cuts, flat fish, clear. ]
Also known as "Wa 1".
(1) The stone mountain of Daitu. "Poetry·Zhou Nan·Juan Er": "Zhi and the stone, I am the horse." Mao Chuan: "The stone mountain wears the soil to say the stone." Refer to the Qing Ma Ruichen's "Mao Shi Zhuan Jian Tong Shi" Volume Seventh Five. One is the earth mountain of Dai Shi.
(2) See "砠".
[②]［zū］
Weighing hammer.
rocky hill
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Afternoon Set 2] [Stone Character Department] 　砠; Kangxi strokes: 10; Page number: page 828 28
[Guang Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] More than seven cuts [Ji Yun] [Zheng Yun] more than a thousand cuts,? [Said Wen] Zuo Wa. 【Erya·Shishan】The soil and the stone are stonestones. 【Poetry·Zhou Nan】Zhi Bi stone.　【Yunhui】The poem says: The earth mountain wears the stone, and the walker thinks it is bitter, so it is clouded by the horse. Mao Chuan: Shishan Daitu. error.
